articles.content:
Solidarity with DPRK Expressed at IFDW Meeting 
   Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the Executive Committee of the International Federation of Democratic Women (IFDW) held in Italy on Nov. 26 adopted a declaration on solidarity with the DPRK.
 The declaration said that it is very important for defending the peace and security of the Korean Peninsula, Asia and the rest of the world to force the U.S. troops to quit south Korea and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.    
 Noting that the IFDW extends firm solidarity to the people and women of the DPRK in their just cause of defending the sovereignty of the country and global peace, the declaration positively supported them in the struggle to force the U.S. troops to withdraw from south Korea and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea by the concerted efforts of the Koreans under the banner of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and strongly denounced the U.S. hostile moves against the DPRK.

articles.content:
Greetings to Romanian President
   Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Traian Basescu, President of Romania, on its national day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in mutual interests, Kim wished the President success in his work for stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to President of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Greetings to Lao President
   Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Choummaly Saynasone, President of Laos, on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of the foundation of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
 The message said that for the past 31 years the Lao people have made great achievements in national defence and economic construction by giving full play to patriotism and the spirit of self-reliant and strenuous efforts under the correct leadership of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party.    
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger and develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message wholeheartedly wished the Lao people fresh success in carrying through the decisions of the 8th congress of the party.

articles.title: DPRK Doctor's Degree Awarded to Korean in Japan
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Democratic Congo
   Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Joseph Kabila on his election as president of Democratic Congo.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work to achieve stability, peace and progress of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Construction Site of Ryesonggang Power Station
articles.content:
DPRK Doctor's Degree Awarded to Korean in Japan
   Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Degree of Doctor of History was awarded to Ryang Kwang U, permanent director of the Osaka Branch of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, in recognition of his positive contribution to the scientific probe into the issue of Koreans' emigration overseas before the liberation of Korea and the disclosure of the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past. 
 An awarding ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.    
 Present there were Kwak Pom Gi, vice-premier of the Cabinet who is chairman of the State Commission for Conferring Degrees and Titles, Kang Chun Gum, secretary general of the commission, Kim Jong Yong, vice-president of the Academy of Social Sciences, and officials concerned.
